thread.title: Yorkshire Ripper Peter Sutcliffe in face to face prison bust-up with Soham child killer Ian Huntley
thread.title_full: Yorkshire Ripper Peter Sutcliffe in face to face prison bust-up with Soham child killer Ian Huntley

author: Dan Thompson
title: Yorkshire Ripper Peter Sutcliffe in face to face prison bust-up with Soham child killer Ian Huntley
text:
Peter Sutcliffe has recently been moved to prison from Broadmoor Hospital after being declared sane Share Get daily     
The Yorkshire Ripper has had a chilling jail run-in with Ian Huntley . 
Mass killer Peter Sutcliffe called the Soham beast a “child killing b d” in the face to face flare-up. 
The Ripper also told 42-year-old ­Huntley to “p*** off” during the ­altercation at their Category A jail. 
The astonishing bust-up was revealed by Sutcliffe’s brother Carl. 
He said: “Peter thinks he’s a higher class of killer than Huntley, but a ­murderer is a murderer in my eyes.” Read More Soham child killer Ian Huntley 'wants a sex change so he can move to women's prison', ex-inmate claims Ian Huntley murdered Soham schoolgirls Holly Wells and Jessica Chapman in 2002 (Photo: PA) 
Huntley is serving two life terms at HMP Frankland for murdering 10-year-olds Holly Wells and Jessica Chapman in Soham, Cambs, in 2002. 
Sutcliffe, caught in 1981 after slaughtering 13 women, was moved to the jail from Broadmoor psychiatric hospital last year after a ruling that he was sane. 
Dismissing rumours the two killers had become pals, Carl, 56, said: “He doesn’t like Huntley at all. Peter’s always been good with kids and he must think killing two children is worse than 13 women. But it doesn’t make sense to me.” 
He claimed Sutcliffe, who feared he would be killed when moved to a jail, has been made welcome by lags at the County Durham prison. Read More Sutcliffe has apparently been made to feel welcome by lags at HMP Frankland (Photo: BBC) 
Carl said: “They’ve been giving him money for stamps so he can write to pen pals.” 
Sutcliffe lost sight in one eye after a 1997 attack and has a growth in the other. Carl said: “One inmate has been leading him around keeping him safe. 
“They’ve all been really nice to him. Now he wishes he’d been moved there years ago.” Like us on Facebook
